title: Spilsby Walks

images.title: Dave Hitchborne, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Spilsby Town Centre, showing Old Town Hall

images.title: Andrew Telfer / St. James; Spilsby, Lincs (+ Church / Boston Roads)
images.caption: St. James, Spilsby. The Parish Church stands on the corner of Church Street and Boston Road. It was built around the beginning of the 14th. Century in the traditional Spilsby sandstone of the area. However, it has been altered many times. Apart from the tower, it was covered with Ancaster stone in 1879. The church contains memorials of the Willoughby de Eresby family, of Sir John Franklin and his two brothers, Major James Franklin and Sir Willingham Franklin. The six bells date from 1744.

images.title: Richard Croft / River Lymn
images.caption: River Lymn north of the town

images.title: Dalby Hall by JOHN BLAKESTON, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dalby Hall

description: This walk explores the area around the market town of Spilsby in Lincolnshire. The town sits on the edge of the Lincolnshire Wolds AONB with numerous public footpaths to follow into the attractive rolling countryside. This circular walk from the town follows paths north through the fields to visit the neighbouring villages of Partney and Skendleby. On the way you will cross the River Lymn and enjoy some fine rural scenery. You then turn west to Dalby, passing Dalby Hall before coming to Langton. The route then heads south to return to Spilsby. To continue your walking in the area head east to visit one of the local highlights at the historic Gunby Hall .
